title: Topic 001 Question 250
body: A security engineer has noticed an unusually high amount of traffic coming from a single IP address. This was discovered by analyzing the Application Load
How can the security engineer limit the number of requests from a specific IP address without blocking the IP address?
options: Add a rule to the Application Load Balancer to route the traffic originating from the IP address in question and show a static webpage.
Implement a rate-based rule with AWS WAF.
Use AWS Shield to limit the originating traffic hit rate.
Implement the GeoLocation feature in Amazon Route 53.
